events.title: Battle of Agincourt
events.description: King Henry V of England led his outnumbered forces to a decisive victory against the French during the Hundred Years' War.
events.significance: This battle enhanced English prestige and Henry V's reputation, influencing the course of the Hundred Years' War.

events.title: Charge of the Light Brigade
events.description: A disastrous British cavalry charge against Russian forces during the Battle of Balaclava in the Crimean War.
events.significance: The event became emblematic of bravery and the futility of war, immortalized in Alfred Lord Tennyson's poem.

events.title: October Revolution in Russia begins
events.description: The Bolsheviks led by Vladimir Lenin launched an armed insurrection against the Provisional Government, marking the start of communist rule in Russia.
events.significance: This event led to the establishment of the Soviet Union, profoundly impacting global politics in the 20th century.

events.title: Liberation of the Philippines' capital Manila
events.description: Filipino and American forces recaptured Manila from Japanese troops during World War II.
events.significance: The liberation was a crucial step towards ending Japanese occupation and restoring Philippine sovereignty.

events.title: United Nations expels Taiwan (Republic of China)
events.description: The UN General Assembly passed Resolution 2758, recognizing the People's Republic of China as the only legitimate representative of China in the United Nations.
events.significance: This shifted international recognition and had significant diplomatic implications during the Cold War era.
